name: Le Reve Hotel & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Le Reve in Jan 2011 was everything we had hoped. Thanks to Jetsetter we got a great deal, but I would recommend this boutique resort even at retail price. There are I believe 4 types of rooms – garden, balcony, master suite, and beach bungalow. We stayed in a garden room, and I think I would prefer it to the balcony room because there is a large outdoor soaking tub that gets hot water—the Jacuzzi section of the *gorgeous* infinity pool does not appear to have heat, so if you are looking for the hot tub experience, this outdoor tub is great for just relaxing in the evenings with a drink or a book. The value of the service at Le Reve is amazing. The staff/guest ratio is so high, at peak times I think there was a staff member on site for each of the 25 rooms! The staff is extremely well trained to attend to your every need, but no one was at all overbearing, annoying, or sales-y.
reviews.title: Relaxing Boutique Resort with 5-Star Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As far as food goes, I am used to Chicago food prices and these seemed reasonable to me. One thing to keep in mind is that all prices include tax AND gratuity. The chef was excellent. I was at first a bit nervous about the food as I had heard it was mostly American-influenced and I like authentic Mexican food. No problem—each evening after dinner, our server Ismael and the Chef worked together to give us authentic options to plan the next night’s meal. We had pork cochinita, a whole roasted fish for 2, barbacoa, chlles rellenos, chicken mole, and barbecue ribs. Our favorites were the barbacoa, chiles rellenos and barbecue ribs, but everything was excellent.
reviews.title: EXTRAORDINARY. CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are not big drinkers, but the drinks were well prepared and the service again was excellent.
reviews.title: GORGEOUS VIEWS AND WONDERFUL SERVICE MADE FOR A PERFECT ENGAGEMENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are kept meticulously every morning and throughout the day—there is not a stone or leaf out of place, ever. There are also nice touches like afternoon tea at 4:30-5pm and nightly turn down service with a little dessert treat. Room service is no extra charge, and neither is pool service, beach service or wherever-you-want-to-eat service.
reviews.title: Truly a slice of heaven....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this hotel gives the feel of a hidden gem with a relaxed, quiet atmosphere. Down the beach to both directions are all-inclusive/annoying spring break type resorts with 1000s of beach chairs, loud music, etc. do yourself a favor and stay at Le Reve. You won’t be disappointed.
reviews.title: Amazing service & delicious food, little disappointed about the beach.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Le Reve to meet up with friends and had a wonderful time at Le Reve. We booked through Jetsetters and we were not disappointed. Rooms were very nice. Staff was wonderful and the restaurant great. Would go there again in a heartbeat. Not easy to find and you must have a car to get around.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at Le Reve, everything just went smoothly. The staff is absolutely excellent. I really can't compliment them enough. There was always someone around if we needed something, without ever feeling like we were being hovered over.
reviews.title: Feels like your own private retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a garden room and as an unexpected bonus had a lovely ocean view. Overall the room was very comfortable and I found the simple decor to be rather soothing. Blackout drapes were a great touch considering that morning sun is very intense.
reviews.title: A tough place to review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate most of our meals there and found the food to be very good. If you wanted something that was not on the menu, the staff was happy to accommodate. The margaritas were great!
reviews.title: I hit it on the mark! Our style in every way...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property as a whole really lovely. There are plenty of lounge chairs for everyone, both at the pool and on the beach. The beach is a bit rocky at the waters edge, but the hotel provides water shoes, as well as snorkeling gear. The only annoyance we found was that the very large hotel nearby has wave runners that were very loud and sometimes a little too close to shore.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, but falls short in the little details sometimes.
Serenity Now
reviews.text: Leave the kids, laptop and cellphones behind! This is for the grown ups. With only 25 rooms it is a gem in Playa which is packed with lovely but impersonal monster resorts. If you're looking for privacy, great food and personal service this is the place. Freddy and Roberto both made the best margaritas I've ever had and Ivan the finest strawberry daiquiri. The beach is a delight, uncrowded, cleaned daily and the sand groomed. Just stroll 1/2 mile and check out the other beaches...though not inexpensive, remember you get what you pay for. If you want to check out, check in to Le Reve.

reviews.title: A real find in Playa
reviews.text: Great spot. Lovely service. Great value. It's not the banyan tree, but it's less than half the price.

reviews.title: Le Reve........"the dream" come true!
reviews.text: We just came back from a fabulous 4 night stay in December at Le Reve. We traveled with another couple and had THE BEST time. We arrived to a tranquil spot, and could not believe the view. The beach was just magnificent. The staff were so accomodating on arrival and throughout our stay.

reviews.title: Beautiful and Peaceful. Wish we could have stayed longer.
reviews.text: The complementary breakfast was outstanding.. couldnt believe this was part of the price of the room ( which was very good to start with). We stayed in the master suite which exceeded our expectations. Huge wow factor and we highly recommend it. The view from the balcony and the spaciousness added so much to the experience.

reviews.title: Never judge a book by its driveway
reviews.text: It was a wonderful each day to start with breakfast and then take a long walk on the beach which goes for miles each way. The beach changes shape and has a lot of character as you walk along especially going left out of the hotel. Yes there were rocks, in front of the hotel, but my husband brought water shoes and had NO trouble getting out. The hotel also provides these along with snorkel gear.

reviews.title: Welcome to our paradise
reviews.text: We recently visited the Le Reve Hotel and Spa in mid-November for our honeymoon. We only had a a short time to getaway and we were looking for something relatively close with white sandy beaches and beautiful accommodations. Le Reve was perfect. Everyone was welcoming and attentive, particularly the concierge and restaurant staff. The hotel is quite small but perfect if you are looking to be away from crowds. Because it is a slower season in November we had the luxury of having most of the hotel to ourselves. The property is well kept, the beach is combed, everyone is friendly and helpful, and the restaurant is delicious! A great getaway from the hustle of NYC.

reviews.title: Wonderful resort
reviews.text: Liked best: Privacy and coziness, most delicious breakfast, cleanliness of the property, staff

reviews.title: Perfect Wedding & Honeymoon Location
reviews.text: Liked least: Mosquitos (although the conceirge did their absolute best to make us as comfortable as possible)

reviews.title: Quiet, private, remote beautiful beach and hotel
reviews.text: We stayed at this resort for a week and were not dissapointed. Everything about this place was wonderful. The room was beautiful with a nice balcony overlooking the pool and sea. The staff was absolutely wonderful especially wonderful. You should definitely try one of the cocktails, they were delicious. The beach was beautiful and very quiet and last but not least, the food was wonderful. We did in Playa del Carmen one night and the staff recommended us to an italian restaurant which was also wonderful.

reviews.title: A Few More Steps & Le Reve Could Be Excellent
reviews.text: So if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing, romantic place you should definitely go to the Le Reve

description: Le Rêve Hotel & Spa, a 25 room boutique hotel right in front of the Caribbean sea, located 10 km North of Playa del Carmen. Enjoy excellent Mexican hospitality and cuisine in a setting of splendor and tranquility. Enjoy a majestic comfort just for adults, in the middle of nature, great privacy, delicately personalized service and a splendid view over the sea. Le Rêve Hotel & Spa, the dream becomes real.
